edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsymmetricEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DamgardJurikEnc
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ScDamgardJurikEnc

    public interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc
extends AsymmetricEnc
    General interface for asymmetric additive homomorphic encryption. Such encryption schemes can compute the encryption of m1+m2, given only the public key and the encryptions of m1 and m2.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

      • add

        AsymmetricCiphertext add(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                         AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2)
        Receives two ciphertexts and return their addition.
        Parameters:
        cipher1 -
        cipher2 -
        Returns:
        the addition result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertexts do not match this asymmetric encryption.

      • add

        AsymmetricCiphertext add(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                         AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2,
                         java.math.BigInteger r)
        Receives two ciphertexts and return their addition.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the add function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional add function that gets the random value from the user.

        Parameters:
        cipher1 -
        cipher2 -
        r - The random value to use in the function.
        Returns:
        the addition result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertexts do not match this asymmetric encryption.

      • multByConst

      • multByConst

        AsymmetricCiphertext multByConst(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher,
                                 java.math.BigInteger constNumber,
                                 java.math.BigInteger r)
        Receives a cipher and a constant number and returns their multiplication.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the multByConst function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional multByConst function that gets the random value from the user.

        Parameters:
        cipher -
        constNumber -
        r - The random value to use in the function.
        Returns:
        the multiplication result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertext does not match this asymmetric encryption.
